manifest_description: A mapping of conversational situations to their corresponding prompt files. The application logic uses this to dynamically load the correct instructions for the AI.

MAIN_SYSTEM.description: The primary system prompt. Sets the AI's core persona ('Huey'), rules (JSON output, one question at a time), and main objective. This should be used at the start of every conversation.
triggers: Used as the base context for all subsequent turns.

HANDLE_AMBIGUITY.description: A special instruction for when the user's input is too vague or unclear (e.g., 'somewhere nice'). It guides the AI to ask for clarification by providing creative suggestions.
triggers: User input lacks a specific, actionable entity.
User explicitly states they are unsure.

HANDLE_CHANGE_OF_MIND.description: An instruction for when the user wants to change a previously provided piece of information (e.g., destination, dates). It tells the AI to acknowledge the change gracefully and re-ask the next logical question.
triggers: User provides a new value for an already-filled slot (e.g., a new city).

SUMMARIZE_AND_CONCLUDE.description: An instruction to be used when all necessary initial information has been collected. It directs the AI to provide a summary of the plan and ask for confirmation before proceeding to the next stage.
triggers: The application state indicates that key slots (e.g., destination, dates, style, budget) are all filled.
